snippet: The $2 billion sale of the Los Angeles Clippers will hinge on whether Rochelle Sterling, the estranged wife of the team’s former owner, Donald Sterling, had the right to unilaterally negotiate the sale under the terms of the family trust.
abstract: California Judge Michael Levanas rules that $2 billion sale of the Los Angeles Clippers will hinge on whether Rochelle Sterling, estranged wife of team’s former owner Donald Sterling, had the right to unilaterally negotiate the sale under the terms of the family trust; other basketball news noted.
lead_paragraph: The $2 billion sale of the Los Angeles Clippers will hinge on whether Rochelle Sterling, the estranged wife of the team’s former owner, Donald Sterling, had the right to unilaterally negotiate the sale under the terms of the family trust.

headline.main: Sterling Case to Focus on Trust Terms
headline.print_headline: Sterling Case to Focus on Trust Terms
